{"step_by_step_thinking": "The glucocorticoid receptor is a type of protein found in cells that responds to glucocorticoids, a type of hormone. When a glucocorticoid binds to the receptor, it changes shape and moves into the cell's nucleus. There, it binds to specific areas of DNA and influences the transcription of certain genes, turning them on or off. This process is characteristic of a transcription factor.", "answer_choice": "A"}
